main event: A ground object smaller than a star was observed hopping, disappearing and reappearing in the sky for 45 minutes on August 23, 1957.
interesting points: The object's flight did not align with known balloon schedules in the area., The sighting lasted for 45 minutes., The object displayed an irregular course and was reddish in color., The observation was made by a Civil Defense Director., The object was described as a moving bright light smaller than a star.
sighted object: a ground object smaller than a star
witness description: Civil Defense Director, age 32, from Olean NY
